{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.10221v1", "title": "Cryogenic Ferroelectric Behavior of Wurtzite Ferroelectrics", "summary": "This study presents the first experimental exploration into cryogenic
ferroelectric behavior in wurtzite ferroelectrics. A breakdown field (EBD) to
coercive field (EC) ratio of 1.8 is achieved even at 4 K, marking the lowest
ferroelectric switching temperature reported for wurtzite ferroelectrics.
Additionally, a significant evolution in fatigue behavior is captured,
transitioning from hard breakdown to ferroelectricity loss at cryogenic
temperatures. These findings unlock the feasibility for wurtzite ferroelectrics
to advance wide temperature non-volatile memory.", "main_category": "cond-mat.mtrl-sci", "categories": "cond-mat.mtrl-sci,physics.app-ph", "published": "2025-04-14T13:43:29Z"}
